Extremely curious Telecommunications Engineer and passionated Software developer human being, always working on/learning something new. I’m not afraid of failing but not doing it.
I really enjoy programming, developing new software, testing from others and build my own.
I love science-fiction books and movies, and motorcycles.
Ruby on Rails lover (intranet web applications and cloud web applications), full stack but backend oriented lately.
I’ve work with Rspec, Sidekiq, AWS ELB, Heroku, Redis, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Jenkins, CircleCI, Docker and many many more frameworks and technologies. Just name it.
I can take your RoR app to the next level by leveraging test cycles, improving scalability, code and system maintenance, increasing dramatically the app performance and applying service oriented architecture.
Some points about my technical profile:
 Ruby on Rails, RoR, Ruby on Rails, RoR, Ruby on Rails! Proven expert on DICOM programming (Healthcare well known ‘universe’: applications like DICOM viewers, PACS, worklist servers, RIS, HIS, OsiriX, DCM4CHEE), Java and FileMaker. Background in Objective-C apps (Cocoa) for Mac OS X and iOS. Plenty of experience developing web applications for different clients and industries  What can I do for you?
 Listen to your needs and plot a plan for your project to be successful and cost-efficient. Orientate and introduce the best software or hardware possibilities for your specific need. Design, create and implement a nice product with the best technologies at the lowest possible cost, I always try to use the free/libre software. Analyse, design, implement/develop and deploy full-custom web applications.  Since 2012, I’ve been quite busy in the development of several web medical management information systems for a lot of medical institutions of any specialty using Ruby on Rails.
In 2017, I moved to other industries like online marketing and started projects on Big Data, and Machine Learning and Financials.
I developed my own full integration of OsiriX, DCM4CHEE and Turyon’s web-based, cloud-deployable RIS (healthcare market).

Click on the **Slides** button above to view the built-in slides feature.   Slides can be added in a few ways:
 Create slides using Academic’s Slides feature and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes. content:
Developed using Ruby on Rails, I managed to create a medical management web application deployable locally or on the cloud from any vendor. The software was able to manage doctor’s appointments, patients medical records, invoices, treatments, medications and it had a dashboard for showing center performance. Codename: Cobalt
It was a very complete piece of software, robust, fast and easy to use. Key features:
 Patient management module Appointments Reports Invoices OsiriX integrated workflow Integrated with Osirix for image review and other external DICOM Viewers Built-in DICOM Worklist server and more…  Screenshots
summary: Extremely complete, easy to use, robust Web Radiologic Information System and Medical Practice Management Sofware
title: Cobalt. Web Medical Practice Management System

content:
Service is still running. I developed it using Ruby on Rails back on 2012, a medical image and medical reporting web application with cloud storage (AWS S3). The software is able to send images using cyphered communications and are sent to cloud after an anonymization process. Service is considered a secured tele-radiology system. Still in use www.mednimbus.com and https://www.dicom-seram.com
Screenshots
summary: Integrated with medical imaging centers with automatic encrypted image upload to the Cloud
title: MedNimbus. Medical Imaging Cloud storage and tele-radiology service

content:
HoruX is (was) a Mac OS X Medical Management desktop application with PostgreSQL database server. I developed it as a Radiologic Information System (RIS) compatible with DICOM servers (know as PACS) and integrated with OsiriX (DICOM Medical Image Viewer). Codename: HoruX.
It was a very complete piece of software, robust, fast and easy to use. Key features:
 Patient management module Appointments Reports Invoices OsiriX integrated workflow Voice dictation and recorder Report encrypted email sending Built-in DICOM Worklist server and more…  Screenshots
summary: Beautiful complete and easy to use Radiologic Information System
title: HoruX. Mac OS X Medical Management Application

Welcome to Slides Academic
Features  Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides  Controls  Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click PDF Export: E  Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...")  Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = \;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}  Press Space to play!
One  Two  Three 
A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
 class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears  Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}}  Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
 Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view   Themes  black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links   night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links  Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/img/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}}  Custom CSS Example Let’s make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; }  Questions? Ask
